title: India fastest growing major economy, Trump's perception of 'dead economy' misplaced: Analysts
summary: Despite US President Trump's "dead economy" remark, international agencies like the IMF project India as the fastest-growing major economy. Experts highlight India's dynamic economy, youthful population, and technological prowess, attracting foreign investment and talent.
fullContent: Despite US President Trump's "dead economy" remark, international agencies like the IMF project India as the fastest-growing major economy. Experts highlight India's dynamic economy, youthful population, and technological prowess, attracting foreign investment and talent. The IMF commends India's prudent policies and forecasts strong growth for 2025 and 2026, supported by other global institutions.

title: Keerthy Suresh leads Fiona Oil's 'Choose Better' campaign
summary: Bunge India's Fiona Refined Sunflower Oil has launched the 'Choose Better. Eat Better.' campaign, fronted by actress Keerthy Suresh, to encourage healthier cooking oil choices among families. The campaign emphasises the importance of oil-conscious decisions alongside...
fullContent: Bunge India's Fiona Refined Sunflower Oil has launched the 'Choose Better. Eat Better.' campaign, fronted by actress Keerthy Suresh, to encourage healthier cooking oil choices among families. The campaign emphasises the importance of oil-conscious decisions alongside health-conscious food choices. Targeting Kannada and Telugu-speaking audiences, Fiona aims to promote smarter cooking through TV, digital platforms, and in-store visibility.

title: Urban demand, tax cuts to drive India's 6.5 pc growth in FY26

fullContent: India's economic growth is expected to hover around 6.5 per cent in the fiscal year 2025-26, driven by a more accommodative interest rate environment, recent income tax cuts, and a likely uptick in urban demand, according to experts.

title: Higher US tariffs may trim GDP growth by 30 bps: Barclays
summary: Barclays estimates that the new 25% US tariffs, along with penalties on Russian imports, could reduce India's GDP growth by 30 basis points this fiscal year. Despite the higher duties, India's domestic demand-driven economy is unlikely to be significantly affected.
fullContent: Barclays estimates that the new 25% US tariffs, along with penalties on Russian imports, could reduce India's GDP growth by 30 basis points this fiscal year. Despite the higher duties, India's domestic demand-driven economy is unlikely to be significantly affected.

summary: Grok is introducing video generation through its new Imagine feature, powered by Aurora. Users will be able to create videos with sound directly from text prompts. Early access begins in October via the standalone Grok app.
fullContent: Grok is introducing video generation through its new Imagine feature, powered by Aurora. Users will be able to create videos with sound directly from text prompts. Early access begins in October via the standalone Grok app. A SuperGrok subscription is required to join the waitlist and access the new feature.

fullContent: Saatvik Green Energy has launched a new advertising campaign. Bollywood superstar Kartik Aaryan is the brand ambassador. The campaign aims to boost solar energy use across India. title: Trump tariff threat to hurt Indian rupee, bonds to see spillover impact
summary: Indian government bonds are predicted to decline, potentially pushing yields past key levels, influenced by a weakening rupee and hawkish signals from the U.S. Federal Reserve. Concerns arise from potential tariffs threatened by President Trump, adding strain to U.S.
fullContent: Indian government bonds are predicted to decline, potentially pushing yields past key levels, influenced by a weakening rupee and hawkish signals from the U.S. Federal Reserve. Concerns arise from potential tariffs threatened by President Trump, adding strain to U.S.-India relations. The Fed's stance suggests a reduced likelihood of a September rate cut, impacting investor sentiment.
